reporting_cycle: every three months; interim report by 12 August 2025; final report by 13 January 2026
summary:
The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on Sudan, determines that the situation in Sudan continues to threaten international peace and security. Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, it:

1. Extends the mandate of the Panel of Experts until 12 March 2026, as originally appointed in resolution 1591 (2005), and reaffirms the Panel's mandate. The Panel is to provide:
   - An interim report to the Security Council Committee by 12 August 2025,
   - A final report to the Council by 13 January 2026 with findings and recommendations, after discussion with the Committee,
   - Updates every three months to the Committee on its activities, travel, and implementation of paragraph 10 of resolution 1945 (2010).
The Council intends to review the mandate and take action on its further extension by 12 February 2026, and encourages cooperation with the Panel.

2. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
